p.s: In Chapterchapter 24 pp. 328-332 from the book The Hate U Give, it really shows the development of the main character Starr.
The scene is told by the main protagonist of the story Starr.
She tells her story from her point of view.
That means she only knows her own feelings and thougtsthoughts that lead to a limited point of view.
You can see that she's telling the story because she's using I while telling the story.
With a first personfirst-person perspective the reader is very close to the action and the reader is emotionally moved in the story.
But it can also give a limited and possible subjective point of view because the reader doesn't get the full picture of the story just only one side.
In the beginning of the szenescene is a use of flashbacks.
Starr takes the story back in time and the scene goes back and forth between the past and present situation (ll. 5-7,19,21,22).
It shows how traumatised Starr still is of Khalil's deaddeath and the Flashbacksflashbacks got triggered by passing by the place it happened.
In line 42-44 Starr is having an interior monologue which presents her thought.
As Starr talktalks in first personfirst-person perspective (ll. 30,36) you can really emphasizeempathise and feel with her.
It helps the reader to imagine the situation Starr is in.
Starr's character develops in this scene because in the beginning she's really shy, scared and overwhelmed but then she finds her voice (l. 48) and is confident.
To summsum up this scene shows how narrative techniques can change and illustrate the readersreader'sview.
